examples: Concern showed in his face.
Local residents have raised concerns about late-night noise.
The jury is still out as concerns the location of the new station.
The Red Cross's primary concern is to preserve and protect human life.
John's family had concerns about his fiancée, suspecting she might be a gold digger who was after his inheritance.
words.defineEn: a subject of significance or interest to someone or something
words.defineVi: một chủ đề có ý nghĩa hoặc quan tâm đến một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: That team has so many injuries right now that it's given us the edge on them.
The doctor examined her neck for any signs of injury.
He suffered a traumatic brain injury in a car accident.
He avoided serious injury following a head-first fall on to the ice.
Many policies do not protect you against personal injury.
words.defineEn: any physical damage to part of the body caused by an accident or attack
words.defineVi: bất kỳ thiệt hại vật chất nào đối với một phần cơ thể do tai nạn hoặc tấn công

examples: The baby cried its head off.
The prisoner held his head in his hands.
Heads are rolling all over the place.
Hold your head up.
Watch your head on the low ceiling.
words.defineEn: the top part of our body, where our brain and face are located
words.defineVi: phần trên cùng của cơ thể chúng ta, nơi đặt bộ não và khuôn mặt của chúng ta

examples: He's still playing his cards close to his chest.
The shirt has a pocket on the chest for small items.
Getting things off your chest can be liberating.
I feel all better now that I got that off my chest.
Thank you for lending an ear, I feel much better now that I've gotten that off my chest.
words.defineEn: the front part of the body between the neck and the stomach
words.defineVi: phần phía trước của cơ thể giữa cổ và dạ dày

examples: The new soldiers had no stomach for a fight.
You must have a cast-iron stomach.
She felt a wave of nausea in her stomach during the car ride.
Do you get butterflies in your stomach when you have to talk to lots of people?
You must have a cast-iron stomach if you're eating pickles with peanut butter!
words.defineEn: the body part inside our body where the food that we eat goes
words.defineVi: phần cơ thể bên trong cơ thể chúng ta, nơi thức ăn chúng ta ăn đi

examples: The two friends were joined at the hip during their college years.
He is shooting from the hip in an act of political desperation.
John and Mary are joined at the hip.
She fell downstairs and broke her hip.
Jeff is a straight talker who always shoots from the hip.
words.defineEn: each of the parts above the legs and below the waist at either side of the body
words.defineVi: mỗi bộ phận phía trên chân và dưới thắt lưng ở hai bên cơ thể

examples: The company was on its knees.
She's the bee's knees.
I must have hit my knee.
The weight of the world pushed him to his knees.
He performed knee exercises to strengthen the muscles around the joint.
words.defineEn: the body part that is in the middle of the leg and helps it bend
words.defineVi: phần cơ thể ở giữa chân và giúp nó uốn cong

examples: Wright turned his ankle in the first minute of the game.
She wore ankle boots that emphasized her cankles.
She turned her ankle on the rocks and had to hobble back to camp.
The young athlete suffered a sprained ankle during the game, but with proper treatment and rehabilitation, she's on the mend and eager to get back on the field.
The X-rays show that he has a broken ankle.
words.defineEn: the joint that connects the foot to the leg
words.defineVi: khớp nối bàn chân với chân

examples: The doctor examined her neck for any signs of injury.
His parents are always breathing down his neck.
My debts are a millstone round my neck.
The bullet got him in the neck.
She wore a necklace around her neck.
words.defineEn: the body part that is connecting the head to the shoulders
words.defineVi: phần cơ thể nối đầu với vai

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The jacket sat beautifully on her shoulders.
He gently rested his chin on her shoulder.
He received a cold shoulder from his former friends after the argument.
She gave a shrug of her shoulders.
words.defineEn: each of the two parts of the body between the top of the arms and the neck
words.defineVi: mỗi bộ phận trong số hai bộ phận của cơ thể giữa đầu cánh tay và cổ

examples: Election season always puts my dad's back up.
Dr. Jaffe pinned her ears back.
Right, pin back your ears, everyone.
I ran the tape back.
The enemy was driven back.
words.defineEn: the part of our body between our neck and our legs that we cannot see
words.defineVi: phần cơ thể giữa cổ và chân mà chúng ta không thể nhìn thấy

examples: Both teams chanced their arms at every opportunity.
His arms dropped limply to his sides.
He moved his arm away from his face.
The mother gently cradled her newborn baby in her arms.
The proud uncle held his newborn nephew in his arms.
words.defineEn: one of the two body parts that is connected to the shoulder and ends with fingers
words.defineVi: một trong hai bộ phận cơ thể được nối với vai và kết thúc bằng ngón tay

examples: The business has legs.
The street vendor served flavorful turkey legs.
At a lively seafood restaurant, guests relished succulent crab legs.
She lost a leg in a car crash.
College tuitions cost an arm and leg nowadays.
words.defineEn: each of the two long body parts that we use when we walk
words.defineVi: mỗi trong số hai bộ phận cơ thể dài mà chúng ta sử dụng khi đi bộ

examples: The Canadian team handed the game to them on a silver plate.
The girl held her father's hand tightly.
She handed me a clean plate for dessert.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The prisoner held his head in his hands.
words.defineEn: the part of our body that is at the end of our arm and we use to grab, move, or feel things
words.defineVi: phần cơ thể nằm ở cuối cánh tay và chúng ta dùng để nắm lấy, di chuyển hoặc cảm nhận đồ vật

examples: Fingers crossed!
A successful investor has his finger on the pulse of international business.
she has her fingers in a lot of pies.
She ran her fingers nervously through her hair.
The musician's fingers lightly touched the piano keys, creating a beautiful melody.
words.defineEn: each of the long thin parts that are connected to our hands, sometimes the thumb is not included
words.defineVi: mỗi phần dài mỏng được nối với bàn tay của chúng tôi, đôi khi không bao gồm ngón tay cái

examples: Some species even have fingernails on their flippers, old souvenirs from their ancient days on land.
Touch your fingernail.
Are your fingernails hurtin'?
My fingernails are dirty.
It's a fingernail.
words.defineEn: the hard smooth part at the end of each finger
words.defineVi: phần mịn cứng ở cuối mỗi ngón tay

examples: His parents footed the bill for his college education.
Not working my foot.
My father always had a lead foot.
Who will be footing the bill for the party?
I dipped my feet in the cool water of the river.
words.defineEn: the body part that is at the end of our leg and we stand and walk on
words.defineVi: phần cơ thể ở cuối chân của chúng ta và chúng ta đứng và đi

examples: The cut and thrust of the business world keeps entrepreneurs on their toes.
The pair went toe to toe until the third set, when Azarenka squandered two match points.
They won't stand toe to toe with us.
The pair went toe to toe until the third set, when Azarenka squandered two match points.
I keep my students on their toes with pop quizzes.
words.defineEn: each of the five parts sticking out from the foot
words.defineVi: mỗi trong số năm phần nhô ra từ bàn chân

examples: She painted her toenails a vibrant shade of red for the beach vacation.
I also painted my toenails.
Do not use a regular human nail or toenail clippers.
But while your fingernails and toenails are protecting your fingers and toes, they slowly wear down.
Among the subjects that people like to talk about debt ranks right between toenail fungus and other people's dreams your brain just doesn't want to hear it.
words.defineEn: the hard smooth part covering the end of each toe
words.defineVi: phần mịn cứng bao phủ cuối mỗi ngón chân

examples: He reached out a hand and touched her forehead.
I try to give people the benefit of the doubt and assume the best in them, as everyone's faults are not written in their forehead.
Forehead reaching toward the earth, palms up.
My last tennis match took place on Link's forehead.
He had a forehead vein.
words.defineEn: the part of the face above the eyebrows and below the hair
words.defineVi: một phần của khuôn mặt trên lông mày và dưới tóc

examples: The tears ran down her cheeks.
She pressed her cheek against the cool glass window.
The baby had chubby cheeks and a cute face.
He planted a gentle kiss on her cheek.
Neither nation is renowned for turning the other cheek.
words.defineEn: any of the two soft sides of our face that are bellow our eyes
words.defineVi: bất kỳ hai mặt mềm mại nào trên khuôn mặt của chúng ta dưới mắt chúng ta

examples: She wore earrings that dangled from her earlobes.
Every part of their look is equally important when it comes to grading, from symmetrical wattles and earlobes to uniformly covered shiny black feathers.
words.defineEn: the soft fleshy part of the external ear
words.defineVi: phần thịt mềm của tai ngoài

examples: Rumors never passed her lips.
Not a drop of liquor has passed my lips.
Read my lips.
Read my lips.
My lips are sealed.
words.defineEn: each of the two body parts that are soft and surround our mouth
words.defineVi: mỗi bộ phận trong số hai bộ phận cơ thể mềm và bao quanh miệng của chúng ta

examples: Tongues were wagging over their engagement.
Tongues wagged when another police car was parked in front of their house.
Snakes use their tongues to smell their surroundings.
Mother clicked her tongue and sighed.
I'm just biting my tongue for now.
words.defineEn: the soft movable part inside the mouth used for tasting something or speaking
words.defineVi: phần mềm di động bên trong miệng được sử dụng để nếm một cái gì đó hoặc nói

examples: The player elbowed his opponent out of the way to gain possession of the ball
The determined fan elbowed his way through the crowd to get closer to the stage.
Oh, did you bonk your elbow?
She elbowed her way to the front of the line to secure the last ticket.
His favorite pair of jeans became out at elbows after years of regular use, developing holes and signs of distress.
words.defineEn: the joint where arms bend; between the upper and lower parts of the arm
words.defineVi: khớp nơi cánh tay uốn cong; giữa phần trên và phần dưới của cánh tay

examples: The farmer witnessed the birth of a baby calf in the barn.
The parents were both highly successful doctors, but their son struggled in medical school, proving that many a good cow has a bad calf.
The chef was known for her delicious dishes, but even she had a few failed experiments, showing that many a good cow has a bad calf.
Maria had been part of a social group, but when she had a falling out with one of the members, they quickly excluded her and moved on, proving that a bellowing cow soon forgets her calf.
Maggie had been committed to a project, but when it became too challenging, she gave up and moved on, proving that a bellowing cow soon forgets her calf.
words.defineEn: the muscular part at the back of the leg between the knee and the ankle
words.defineVi: phần cơ ở phía sau chân giữa đầu gối và mắt cá chân

examples: Look at little baby's adorable thunder thighs!
I asked my mother to prepare a delicious honey-glazed roasted turkey thigh for dinner.
Growing up, Jason was teased for his larger thighs, but he eventually learned to love and appreciate his thunder thighs for their strength and endurance.
They marinated their chicken thighs in a mixture of mace, garlic, and lemon juice.
The skinless turkey thighs were tender and juicy, perfect for a Thanksgiving dinner.
words.defineEn: the top part of the leg between the hip and the knee
words.defineVi: phần trên cùng của chân giữa hông và đầu gối
